intro: Verbascum lagurus subsp. stefanovii, commonly known as Stefanov's mullein, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers in clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
